nodes.documentation:
@notice  Gets the burnt yield of the portfolio entered

  /// @dev     Burnt yield is a strange concept forcibly created by
          the way we conceptually withdraw value from platforms.
          We should refactor that behaviour and then get
          rid of this variable. Need to actualy think it all
          through first since other things might be tied to
          that system as well.
nodes.name: getWithdrawnYield
getAvailableCapital

nodes.documentation: ----------------- ONLY STORAGE WRAPPERS STATE SPECIFIC MUTATORS ----------------- *
nodes.name: deleteTokenValues
addOpportunity
setValidOpportunity
setBoolean

getAvailableCapital(bytes32).details: Available capital is the amount of funds available to a portfolio          to lend out. This is based on users depositing funds into it.

getCumulativeRate(address).details: The cumulative rate tracks how the benchmark rate has          progressed over time. Used in our fee model to find          what benchmark rate is appropriate to a unique token          based on when they joined and the changes the rate          went through in that time period before they withdraw.

getEntryRate(bytes32,bytes32).details: I say 'entered' because when a token adds capital or partially withdraws          or anytime it changes it's token capital we reset this. Originally          called it entryRate since we first set it when the token is created. we should refactor this to a more appropriate          name

getRealizedYield(bytes32).details: Historical yield is the yield we've made, but withdrew          back into the system and now use it as capital

getTokenAllowance(bytes32,bytes32).details: Each token has an allowance which reflects how much yield they're          able to make without being charged a fee by us.

getVerifier(bytes32).details: Can't remember added value over using getContractAddress()   /// TODO:    Think of why, else refactor out

getWithdrawnYield(bytes32).details: Burnt yield is a strange concept forcibly created by          the way we conceptually withdraw value from platforms.          We should refactor that behaviour and then get          rid of this variable. Need to actualy think it all          through first since other things might be tied to          that system as well.

params.contractName: - The name of the contract prepended with 'get' currently

params.action: - the action we wish to carry out, true to add, false to remove
params.oracle: - the address of the wallet targeted

params.action: - the action we wish to carry out, true to add, false to remove
params.theStorageWrapper: - the address to either add or remove

setValidOpportunity(bytes32,bytes32).details: We set the valid opportunities in an array, but we also set them           here for quicker access instead of having to iterate through the array           Sacrifice the extra gas cost (20,000) per opportunity we 'double set'

addOpportunity(bytes32,bytes32,address).notice: TODO:    This is in-efficient, we set the principal address multiple times          for the same portfolio. Fix this.   /// TODO:     Should I refactor principalToken -> principalAddress or opposite?

deleteTokenValues(bytes32,bytes32).notice: ----------------- ONLY STORAGE WRAPPERS STATE SPECIFIC MUTATORS ----------------- *

getACPContribution(address).notice: Gets the ACP Contribution by coin-type

getAvailableCapital(bytes32).notice: Gets the available capital of a portfolio.

getBenchmarkRate(address).notice: Gets the current baseline benchmark rate of this coin

getContractAddress(bytes32).notice: Gets a contract address by a hash, our current pattern has it starting          with 'get'.   ///          Ex. keccak256("OpportunityManagerContract"); though nothing is wrong with          just getContractAddress(keccak256("OpportunityManagerContract")) so maybe          the 'get' will be refactored out

getCumulativeRate(address).notice: Gets the cumulative rate of the portfolio entered

getEntryRate(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Gets the value of the cumulative rate the token 'entered' at.

getLastUpdatedRate(address).notice: Gets the last time in seconds the cumulative rate was          was updated.

getMinAmount(address).notice: TODO: Remove this (and refactor the check used in PositionManager associated)

getOpportunities(bytes32).notice: Get the Opportunities this portfolio is allowed to be in

getOpportunityToken(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Gets the Opportunity Token of a RAY. We assume a RAY will only need          one of a certain Opportunity Token. It shouldn't ever need multiple          of the same kind.

getPrincipalAddress(bytes32).notice: Get's the coin type of the entered RAY   /// TODO:    Refactor to getPrincipalToken since we commonly use that

getRealizedYield(bytes32).notice: Gets the historical yield of the portfolio entered

getTokenAllowance(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Gets the entered RAY Tokens allowance

getTokenKey(bytes32).notice: Each token is mapped to a key that unlocks everything for it          in storage.

getVerifier(bytes32).notice: Maps portfolio's to the contract that they currently are used          through.

getWithdrawnYield(bytes32).notice: Gets the burnt yield of the portfolio entered

isValidOpportunity(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Checks if the opportunity exists for this RAY (aka portfolio)

setBoolean(bytes32,bytes32,bool).notice: We have these to enable us to be flexible with our eternal storage          in the future. Also, we could always deploy a new Storage contract          and reference two Storage contracts in the system and so on.

setContractAddress(bytes32,address).notice: Sets the contract address mapped to a contracts name

setGovernanceWallet(address).notice: This sets the Governance Wallet - important since this wallet controls          the Admin contract that controls 'Governance' in the system.

setValidOpportunity(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Set an opportunity as valid in a mapping to a portfolio key
